channel.title: Aurous - My Attempt at an open source spotify alternative
channel.description:
I've been working on a new application that will allow you to bring all of your favorite playlist from the likes of; Youtube, SoundCloud, Pandora, Spotify, Grooveshark and more into a single place to listen to instantly. All for free with no ads or downloading required. Project Poptart is going live for its initial beta release and I'd love if you would take part in it. Read all about it below.
[URL=http://blog.poptart.me/post/96468889903/project-poptart-2-0-more-music-less-problems]Project Poptart 2.0[/URL]

item.title: Aurous - My Attempt at an open source spotify alternative
item.dc:creator: @Codeusa11 Codeusa11
item.description:
@Codeusa11 wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:17, topic:546464”][quote author=Codeusa11 link=topic=665363.msg4448730#msg4448730 date=1410145433]
The app is now called Aurous http://aurous.me/
[/quote]
Dark Souls reference or the literal definition?: http://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/aurous[/quote]

Literal definition, used the same name on an older project I canned

http://blog.aurous.me/post/96904621143/project-poptart-is-now-aurous

Read full topic

item.title: Aurous - My Attempt at an open source spotify alternative
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

Yeah I was thinking about doing the exact same thing at one point. I was going to make a simple node-webkit app that used some sort of free API to find album/artist information, then in the background, download and stream the audio of YouTube videos.

Read full topic

item.title: Aurous - My Attempt at an open source spotify alternative
item.dc:creator: @Codeusa11 Codeusa11
item.description:
@Codeusa11 wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:10, topic:546464”][quote author=Codeusa11 link=topic=665363.msg4448013#msg4448013 date=1409878088]

Even though you’re streaming music via other services I still feel like record companies are going to try to pound you into the ground with licensing.

He would just have to move the server outside US’ jurisdiction.

First that isn’t how copyright laws work, second I’m not going to host any content.
[/quote]
After really thinking about it this isn’t even kind of a spotify alternative, it’s really just a GUI that you use to organize music links that you can stream through the program.[/quote]

free
no ads
search for music
get instant music
add playlist from multiple services
not spotify

That alone makes its a spotify alternative

Basic soundcloud done http://blog.poptart.me/post/96669763713/2-1-5-changelog

Read full topic
item.source: Aurous - My Attempt at an open source spotify alternative

item.title: Aurous - My Attempt at an open source spotify alternative
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“Codeusa11, post:9, topic:546464”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=665363.msg4447985#msg4447985 date=1409867552]

Even though you’re streaming music via other services I still feel like record companies are going to try to pound you into the ground with licensing.

He would just have to move the server outside US’ jurisdiction.
[/quote]

First that isn’t how copyright laws work, second I’m not going to host any content.[/quote]
After really thinking about it this isn’t even kind of a spotify alternative, it’s really just a GUI that you use to organize music links that you can stream through the program.

Read full topic

made available through the YouTube API;

No api uses outside of the public gdata information on videos; which is just title, length and thumbnails

item.title: Aurous - My Attempt at an open source spotify alternative
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“https://developers.google.com/youtube/terms”]Your API Client will not, and You will not encourage or create functionality for Your users or other third parties to:
…
8. separate, isolate, or modify the audio or video components of any YouTube audiovisual content made available through the YouTube API;[/quote]

brb reporting to google

Read full topic
item.source: Aurous - My Attempt at an open source spotify alternative

item.title: Aurous - My Attempt at an open source spotify alternative
item.dc:creator: @Codeusa11 Codeusa11
item.description:
@Codeusa11 wrote:

Davidi2:

Just from a really quick glance, it looks like you should put some time into fixing up the design of the app. It looks kinda disorganized and haphazard. Also you probably shouldn’t use a trademark name if you want to gain any popularity

A redesign is coming when I have my friend get done doing the new mockups.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=osk6-Gja9TA

The current version could use improvements though I won’t deny that.

Also surprisingly Poptart isn’t copyrighted, its Pop-tarts that is. However its just the project name.

Read full topic
